summary: This FBI document requests the opening of a new obstruction of justice investigation (72-MM-113327) into Alfredo Rodriguez, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein. Rodriguez attempted to sell documents related to a civil lawsuit against Epstein to attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000, despite having been subpoenaed to provide them.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, subject of obstruction investigation
persons.context: Former employee of Jeffrey Epstein who attempted to sell documents related to a civil lawsuit against Epstein to attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000, despite being under a federal subpoena to provide them.

persons.name: Bradley James Edwards
persons.role: Attorney representing plaintiffs in civil suit against Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Attorney representing four female individuals suing Jeffrey Epstein. He deposed Alfredo Rodriguez, served him with a federal subpoena, and reported Rodriguez's attempt to sell the subpoenaed documents.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of a civil lawsuit brought by four female individuals represented by Bradley Edwards. His former employee, Alfredo Rodriguez, possessed documents related to the case.

connections.description: Rodriguez was an employee for Epstein, as stated in the document.
Edwards, as an attorney in a civil suit against Epstein, deposed Rodriguez and served him with a federal subpoena. Rodriguez then attempted to sell documents to Edwards.
Edwards is the attorney representing four female individuals who are suing Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Contact between Rodriguez and Edwards
events.description: On or about August 2009, attorney Bradley Edwards was contacted by Alfredo Rodriguez regarding documents related to the Epstein civil case.

events.title: FBI opens obstruction of justice investigation
events.description: The FBI drafts a document to open a new obstruction of justice matter (72-MM-113327) against Alfredo Rodriguez based on his attempt to sell subpoenaed documents.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, a former employee of Jeffrey Epstein, attempted to sell documents related to a civil lawsuit against Epstein to attorney Bradley Edwards for $50,000.
Rodriguez had already been deposed by Edwards and served with a federal subpoena requiring him to provide the documents, making his sale demand potentially illegal.
The FBI is opening a formal obstruction of justice investigation (Case 72-MM-113327) into Rodriguez's actions based on this information.
Bradley Edwards is identified as the attorney representing four female individuals in a civil suit against Jeffrey Epstein.
The document reveals an attempt to monetize evidence in the Epstein case by an insider, highlighting potential witness tampering or evidence obstruction.
